parameters.content:
# âš ï¸ ADVANCED USE ONLY

### ðŸš¨ This workflow is for advanced users only!

This MCP server contains **75 operations** which is significantly more than the recommended maximum of 40 tools for most AI clients.

### ðŸ” Recommended Alternative
**Seek a simplified MCP server** that utilizes the official n8n tool implementation for Radio & Music Services if available, as it will be more efficient and easier to manage.

### ðŸ› ï¸ Advanced Usage Instructions

**BEFORE adding this MCP server to your client:**
### Disable or delete unused nodes - Review sections and disable/delete those you don't need

**AFTER adding the MCP server to your client:**
1.**Selective tool enabling** - Instead of enabling all tools (default), manually select only the specific tools you need for *that* Workflow's MCP client.
2. **Monitor performance** - Too many tools can slow down AI responses

### ðŸ’¡ Pro Tips
**Keep maximum 40 enabled tools** - Most AI clients perform better with fewer tools
- Group related operations and only enable one group at a time
- Use the overview note to understand what each operation group does
- Consider creating multiple smaller MCP servers for different use cases
- Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) if your business needs this implemented professionally

### âš™ï¸ Setup Instructions

1. **Import Workflow**: 
Load this workflow into your n8n instance

2. **Authentication**: 
No authentication required

3. **Activate Workflow**:
Enable the workflow to start the MCP server

4. **Get MCP URL**: 
Copy the webhook URL from the MCP trigger

5. **Connect AI Agent**:
Use the MCP URL in your AI agent configuration


### ðŸ’¡ Usage Notes
â€¢ Parameters are auto-populated by AI using $fromAI() expressions
â€¢ With 75 API endpoints available as tools
â€¢ Responses maintain original API structure


### ðŸ› ï¸ Customization
â€¢ Add data transformation nodes if needed
â€¢ Implement custom error handling
â€¢ Add logging or monitoring nodes

â€¢ Modify parameter defaults in any HTTP request node as needed

### ðŸ’¬ Need Help?
Ping me on [discord](https://discord.me/cfomodz) for integration guidance and custom automations. Check the [n8n documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/cluster-nodes/sub-nodes/n8n-nodes-langchain.toolmcp/) for more information.

## ðŸ› ï¸ Radio & Music Services MCP Server âœ… 75 operations

### About
We encapsulate Radio & Music business logic for iPlayer Radio and BBC Music products on all platforms. We add value by reliably providing the right blend of metadata needed by clients.

### ðŸ”§ How it Works

This workflow converts the Radio & Music Services API into an MCP-compatible interface for AI agents.

â€¢ **MCP Trigger**: Serves as your server endpoint for AI agent requests
â€¢ **HTTP Request Nodes**: Handle API calls to https://rms.api.bbc.co.uk/
â€¢ **AI Expressions**: Automatically populate parameters via `$fromAI()` placeholders
â€¢ **Native Integration**: Returns responses directly to the AI agent


### ðŸ“‹ Available Operations (75 endpoints)

**Broadcasts (3 operations)**
broadcasts, latest

**Categories (2 operations)**
list, category

**Collections (1 operations)**
collection

**Experience (1 operations)**
homepage

**Music (22 operations)**
popular, single, favourite, followed

**Personalised Categories (3 operations)**
unfollow, list, follow

**Music Export (11 operations)**
music

**Personalised Networks (3 operations)**
unfollow, list, follow

**Personalised Plays (1 operations)**
write

**Play Space (2 operations)**
suggested, playspace

**Programmes (4 operations)**
recommended, popular, radio, available

**Radio (17 operations)**
favourite, followed, played

**Podcasts (4 operations)**
all, featured, podcast

**Networks (1 operations)**
networks

parameters.name: sort
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sort', 'Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Broadcasts

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ offset (optional) - Paginated results offset
  â€¢ limit (optional) - Paginated results limit
  â€¢ service_id (optional) - Filter by Service ID. E.g. bbc_radio_fourfm
  â€¢ date (optional) - Filter by date. E.g. 2016-06-17
  â€¢ sort (optional) - Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.name: on_air
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('on_air', 'Filter what is on air. E.g. 'now' returns current programme being broadcasted.', 'string') }}

parameters.name: next
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('next', 'Filter what will be on air next in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the next four hurs', 'string') }}

parameters.name: previous
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('previous', 'Filter what was on air previously in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the previous four hurs', 'string') }}

parameters.name: sort
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('sort', 'Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
Latest Broadcasts

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ offset (optional) - Paginated results offset
  â€¢ limit (optional) - Paginated results limit
  â€¢ service_id (optional) - Filter by Service ID. E.g. bbc_radio_fourfm
  â€¢ on_air (optional) - Filter what is on air. E.g. 'now' returns current programme being broadcasted.
  â€¢ next (optional) - Filter what will be on air next in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the next four hurs
  â€¢ previous (optional) - Filter what was on air previously in minutes. E.g. '240' returns programmes broadcasted in the previous four hurs
  â€¢ sort (optional) - Sort by provided query. E.g. 'start_at' sorts in ascending order, and '-start_at' sorts in descending order
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

Broadcasts by PID

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  â€¢ pid (required) - pid
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.name: kind
parameters.value: ={{ $fromAI('kind', 'Filter by provided query. E.g. 'promoted' returns promoted categories', 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
List of categories

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ kind (optional) - Filter by provided query. E.g. 'promoted' returns promoted categories
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

Category by ID

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  â€¢ id (required) - Retrieve information about the category. E.g. 'sport-football-europeanchampionship'
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

Collection Members

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  â€¢ pid (required) - pid
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ offset (optional) - Paginated results offset
  â€¢ limit (optional) - Paginated results limit
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

Homepage Experience

Parameters:
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.toolDescription:
Popular Artists

Parameters:

  â€¢ since (optional) - ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd. Returns items between given time period and now
  â€¢ until (optional) - ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd. Returns items between given 'since' and 'until' date params
  â€¢ decomposed (optional) - In addition to the overall score, return a list of scores broken down by day N.B Must be used in conjunction with since and/or until and since is >= 31 days
  â€¢ offset (optional) - Paginated results offset
  â€¢ limit (optional) - Paginated results limit
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.toolDescription:
Popular Tracks

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ since (optional) - ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd. Returns items between given time period and now
  â€¢ until (optional) - ISO 8601 Date yyyy-mm-dd. Returns items between given 'since' and 'until' date params
  â€¢ network (optional) - Return items with given Network ID
  â€¢ programme (optional) - Items with given Programme Pid
  â€¢ artist (optional) - MusicBrainz artist ID
  â€¢ decomposed (optional) - In addition to the overall score, return a list of scores broken down by day N.B Must be used in conjunction with since and/or until and since is >= 31 days
  â€¢ offset (optional) - Paginated results offset
  â€¢ limit (optional) - Paginated results limit
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.toolDescription:
Popular Episodes & Clips

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ type (optional) - Programme type required. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ distinct (optional) - Filter by deduplication rule. E.g. 'tleo' returns programmes with distinct top level episode objects
  â€¢ network (optional) - Filter by network master brand ID (mid). Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ network_url_key (optional) - Filter by network URL key. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ category (optional) - Filter by category. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ format (optional) - Filter by format. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ group (optional) - Filter by group. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ media_type (optional) - Filter by programme media type. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ container (optional) - Filter by container. Accepts any pid e.g. brand,series,episode
  â€¢ media_set (optional) - Filter by media set name. Accepts comma separated combinations of the following: pc,mobile-download,android-download-high,apple-ios-download-high,mobile-cellular-main,mobile-phone-main,iptv-all
  â€¢ q (optional) - Search query String
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

parameters.toolDescription:
Radio programmes

Parameters:
- Query parameters:
  â€¢ kind (optional) - Filter by provided query. E.g. 'tleo' returns top level objects, ie. brands, orphaned series, and orphaned episodes
  â€¢ network (optional) - Filter by network master brand ID (mid). Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ network_url_key (optional) - Filter by network URL key. Accepts comma separated values
  â€¢ category (optional) - Filter by category id. Accepts comma separated values. See /category endpoint below for the type of response provided
  â€¢ sort (optional) - Sort by provided query. E.g. 'title' sorts in ascending order, and -title sorts in descending order
  â€¢ container (optional) - Filter by container. Accepts any brand or series pid
  â€¢ type (optional) - Filter by programme type. Accepts comma separated values
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY

Parameters:
- Path parameters:
  â€¢ pid (required) - pid
- Header parameters:
  â€¢ X-API-Key (required) - API_KEY
